senses.de: A large piece of soft cloth used for keeping warm, usually while sleeping.
senses.ex: She wrapped herself in a blanket.

Tips.title: Physical Comfort
Tips.description: Used to suggest warmth and comfort, especially in a home setting.
Tips.example: Curling up with a blanket, she read her book.

Tips.title: Protection
Tips.description: Can imply safety, used metaphorically to describe protecting emotions.
Tips.example: His kind words provided a blanket of comfort.

Tips.title: Home Essential
Tips.description: Seen as a basic household item, often mentioned in home-related topics.
Tips.example: Make sure to have extra blankets for guests.

senses.de: Covering all cases or instances, all-encompassing.
senses.ex: There is a blanket ban on smoking in this area.

Tips.title: Absolute Extent
Tips.description: Stresses the completeness or totality of an action or rule.
Tips.example: The blanket ban left no exceptions.

Tips.title: Lacks Specificity
Tips.description: Indicates a lack of detail or a general approach when used as an adjective.
Tips.example: His blanket statement was too vague.

senses.de: To cover something completely with a thick layer.
senses.ex: The town was blanketed with snow overnight.

Tips.title: Thorough Coverage
Tips.description: Emphasizes covering something completely, leaving no part exposed.
Tips.example: Heavy clouds blanketed the sky, hiding the stars.

Tips.title: Visual Imagery
Tips.description: Often used to create a vivid picture of landscapes or scenes.
Tips.example: A thick blanket of fog swallowed the streets.

senses.de: A heavy, loosely woven fabric usually of wool, and having a nap, used in bed clothing.
senses.ex: The woolen blanket was warm and comfortable.

Tips.title: Quality Indicator
Tips.description: Used to specify the type of material, suggesting quality, like 'woolen'.
Tips.example: Her grandmother knitted a soft cashmere blanket.

Tips.title: Historical Use
Tips.description: Refers to traditional or old-fashioned kinds of blankets or their uses.
Tips.example: The museum displayed blankets used by pioneers.

Afghan.wordDefinition:
An Afghan is a type of blanket that is usually made from yarn or wool and is crocheted or knitted into a specific pattern or design.

So, while a blanket can refer to any type of fabric used for warmth or comfort, an Afghan is a specific type of blanket with a unique design or pattern.

Comfort.wordDefinition:
A blanket is a piece of fabric or covering usually used for warmth or to cover oneself while sleeping. It is a functional item that can be used to keep the body warm or wrapped around oneself for comfort.

Comfort refers to a feeling of ease or contentment. It is a state of physical or emotional well-being where an individual feels at ease or relaxed.

A blanket is a physical item used for warmth and comfort while comfort is a feeling of ease.

A blanket can provide physical comfort while comfort can refer to emotional or mental well-being.

Cover.wordDefinition:
A cover can be used to conceal or protect an object or piece of furniture. It's often made of thinner material than a blanket and is designed to fit a specific item, such as a sofa cover, car cover, or book cover.

A blanket is used for warmth and comfort, while a cover is used for protection or concealment.

Coverlet.wordDefinition:
A coverlet is a decorative bedspread usually thinner and lighter than a blanket.

Both can provide warmth and decoration to a bed or room, however, a blanket is typically more functional, whereas a coverlet is more often used for styling purposes.

Overlay.wordDefinition:
An overlay is a layer that is put on top of something else.

For example, you could put a blanket on your bed to keep warm while you sleep. An overlay, however, could be a decorative runner laid across the top of the bed to add color or texture to the room.

An overlay can also be used in graphic design to add text or images over an existing image or background.

A blanket is used for warmth and insulation, while an overlay is used for decoration or protection.

Quilt.wordDefinition:
A quilt is a type of blanket but it has several layers of fabric that are stitched together to create a pattern. Quilts are usually made from pieces of fabric that are sewn together to create a design.

They are often used as a decorative element in a room but can also be used for warmth. Quilts are generally more elaborate and decorative than blankets.

In summary, blankets are simple and made of one layer of fabric, while quilts are made of multiple layers of fabric sewn together to create a design.

Blankets are used for warmth and comfort while quilts can also serve a decorative purpose.

Shawl.wordDefinition:
A blanket is typically larger and thicker than a shawl.

A shawl is a lighter and more decorative piece of clothing.

It is typically worn around the shoulders or draped over the arms. Shawls are often made of finer fabrics, such as silk or cashmere, and are commonly worn to dress up an outfit or add a pop of color.

Overall, blankets are used for warmth and comfort, while shawls are more of a fashion accessory.

Throw.wordDefinition:
A throw is a smaller and thinner covering that is often used for decoration or to add a layer of warmth to a seating area.

So, blankets are for covering and keeping warm, while throws are for decoration or adding a layer of warmth to a seating area.

Wrap.wordDefinition:
A wrap is similar to a blanket, but it is often thinner and usually used for covering a specific part of the body like the shoulders, neck or head.

A blanket is used to cover the entire body while resting or sleeping, while a wrap is used to cover a specific body part or worn as a fashion accessory.

videos.Text: The cancer was too advanced. But I was committed to making sure that I could do anything possible to make her stay more comfortable. I brought her a warm blanket and a cup of a coffee. I brought some for her parents. But more importantly, see, I passed no judgment on her,
videos.Title: Peter Attia: What if...

quotes.Text: Let me tell you about the nap. It's absolutely fantastic. When I was a kid, my father was always trying to tell me how to be a man. And he said - I was maybe nine - he said, 'Philip, whenever you take a nap, take your clothes off and put a blanket over you, and you're going to sleep better.' Well, as with everything, he was right.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Philip Roth

quotes.Text: Look - I'm an African-American. I'm black. But I'm just looking at the character and trying to find his soul, his energy. If you can wipe away the blanket of skin and flesh that people tend to see, and look inside for the essence of the soul, then that's the work I'm doing. That's the work I always do.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Forest Whitaker

quotes.Text: It seems that with other kind of music, they are looking for the next big thing, but with country music, they might be looking for that, but they also want to have that warm blanket that helped them through that relationship or that singer they have always loved.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Darius Rucker

quotes.Text: I love white shirts because they feel like a security blanket. You can wear them with anything. It's the person and the way that they wear it that makes it different. I have been designing white shirts forever, but I don't get tired of it.
quotes.Title: Venezuelan Designer
quotes.Name: Carolina Herrera

quotes.Text: Throughout my childhood, when I raised my blanket in the morning, I saw a black, sparkling powder float off it. My socks were always black with coal dirt when I took off my shoes at night.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Homer Hickam

quotes.Text: Save the Children is an awesome charity that has helped more than 125 million children around the world, providing everything from school books to food to blankets and shelter.
quotes.Title: Swedish Entertainer
quotes.Name: PewDiePie

quotes.Text: Think what a better world it would be if we all, the whole world, had cookies and milk about three o'clock every afternoon and then lay down on our blankets for a nap.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Barbara Jordan

quotes.Text: I'm used to playing characters that are so different to me and I love that; it's my safety blanket and I hide behind the character.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Sacha Dhawan

quotes.Text: If I had a comfort blanket, I wouldn't have been as passionate and driven.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Rob James-Collier

quotes.Text: Clothing & fashion are kind of my security blanket, almost.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Billie Eilish
